term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - bond energy (mean bond energy)
term.title: bond energy

item.text: The average value of the gas-phase bond dissociation energies (usually at a temperature of 298 K) for all bonds of the same type within the same chemical species. The mean bond energy for methane, for example, is one-fourth the enthalpy of reaction for: [image: Not defined] Tabulated bond energies are generally values of bond energies averaged over a number of selected typical chemical species containing that type of bond.
